intro: Pentacalia cutervonis, commonly known as the showy pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
